headline.main: F.D.A. REPORT SPLITS ON EFFECTS OF SUGAR

docs.lead_paragraph: Upholding a warning that dentists have sounded for years, the Food and Drug Administration says in a report by three staff scientists that sugar contributes to tooth decay. The report, issued Tuesday, also says that a three-year review of a decade of research found no evidence that sugar alone causes obesity, diabetes, high blood pressure, coronary heart disease or behavior problems in most children. However, the scientists found, ''The consumption of sucrose and fermentable carbohydrates facilitates the development of plaque, dental caries and periodontal disease.''
